comment._content:
It was just about to be "re-modelled" for the widening of Sussex Street / Hickson Road (eastern side), near the junction with Napoleon street. The rebuilt warehouse is still there and partly recognisable - see Google Street View - g.co/maps/gnwy5 . The old warehouse in the middle of Sussex St. shows up on the c.1927 map - www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/6662642331/
" The remodelling of the Grafton Bond consequent upon the widening of Hickson-road was further advanced by the demolition of the front portion of "E" Store, the erection of a new brick front, and the completion of the southern addition facing Sussex-street. " SMH 04/01/1928. p.9 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16431407
I wonder if the original architect was the same as for this building nearby - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2713156400/]
